etymology.description: Originally a pictogram of a bundle; simplified to 东 (dōng, "east") in cursive, mirroring 車 (chē, "vehicle") to 车
etymology.interpretation: The character 東 originally depicted a bundle of objects tied together, visually symbolizing the concept of 'east' through its form. As writing evolved, the character was simplified to 东, following a similar reduction from 車 to 车. This simplification focused on retaining core visual elements while removing complexity.
etymology.simplification: The simplification from 東 to 东 involved a reduction to a cursive shorthand form, parallel to 車 becoming 车.

examples.chinese: 太阳从东边升起(太陽從東邊升起)。
examples.english: The sun rises from the east.

examples.chinese: 风从东面吹来(風從東面吹來)。
examples.english: The wind blows from the east.
